bombs.name: Acid Flask (Lesser)
bombs.text: This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, the listed persistent acid damage, and the listed acid splash damage. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. It deals 1d6 persistent acid damage and 1 acid splash damage.

bombs.name: Acid Flask (Moderate)
bombs.text: This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, the listed persistent acid damage, and the listed acid splash damage. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 2d6 persistent acid damage and 2 acid splash damage.

bombs.name: Acid Flask (Greater)
bombs.text: This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, the listed persistent acid damage, and the listed acid splash damage. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 3d6 persistent acid damage and 3 acid splash damage.

bombs.name: Acid Flask (Major)
bombs.text: This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, the listed persistent acid damage, and the listed acid splash damage. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 4d6 persistent acid damage and 4 acid splash damage.

bombs.name: Alchemist's Fire (Lesser)
bombs.text: Alchemist’s fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist’s fire deals the listed fire damage, persistent fire damage, and splash damage. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 1d8 fire damage, 1 persistent fire damage, and 1 fire splash damage.

bombs.name: Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)
bombs.text: Alchemist’s fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist’s fire deals the listed fire damage, persistent fire damage, and splash damage. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage.

bombs.name: Alchemist's Fire (Greater)
bombs.text: Alchemist’s fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist’s fire deals the listed fire damage, persistent fire damage, and splash damage. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 3d8 fire damage, 3 persistent fire damage, and 3 fire splash damage.

bombs.name: Alchemist's Fire (Major)
bombs.text: Alchemist’s fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist’s fire deals the listed fire damage, persistent fire damage, and splash damage. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 4d8 fire damage, 4 persistent fire damage, and 4 fire splash damage.

bombs.name: Bottled Lightning (Lesser)
bombs.text: Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals the listed electricity damage and electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes flat-footed until the start of your next turn. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. It deals 1d6 electricity damage and 1 electricity splash damage.

bombs.name: Bottled Lightning (Moderate)
bombs.text: Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals the listed electricity damage and electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes flat-footed until the start of your next turn. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 2d6 electricity damage and 2 electricity splash damage.

bombs.name: Bottled Lightning (Greater)
bombs.text: Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals the listed electricity damage and electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes flat-footed until the start of your next turn. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 3d6 electricity damage and 3 electricity splash damage.

bombs.name: Bottled Lightning (Major)
bombs.text: Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals the listed electricity damage and electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes flat-footed until the start of your next turn. Many types grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 4d6 electricity damage and 4 electricity splash damage.

bombs.name: Frost Vial (Lesser)
bombs.text: The liquid reagents in this vial rapidly absorb heat when exposed to air. A frost vial deals the listed cold damage and cold splash damage. On a hit, the target takes a status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn. Many types of frost vial also grant an item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 1d6 cold damage and 1 cold splash damage, and the target takes a –5-foot penalty.

bombs.name: Frost Vial (Moderate)
bombs.text: The liquid reagents in this vial rapidly absorb heat when exposed to air. A frost vial deals the listed cold damage and cold splash damage. On a hit, the target takes a status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn. Many types of frost vial also grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls, the bomb deals 2d6 cold damage and 2 cold splash damage, and the target takes a –10-foot penalty.

bombs.name: Frost Vial (Greater)
bombs.text: The liquid reagents in this vial rapidly absorb heat when exposed to air. A frost vial deals the listed cold damage and cold splash damage. On a hit, the target takes a status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn. Many types of frost vial also grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls, the bomb deals 3d6 cold damage and 3 cold splash damage, and the target takes a –10-foot penalty.

bombs.name: Frost Vial (Major)
bombs.text: The liquid reagents in this vial rapidly absorb heat when exposed to air. A frost vial deals the listed cold damage and cold splash damage. On a hit, the target takes a status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn. Many types of frost vial also grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls, the bomb deals 4d6 cold damage and 4 cold splash damage, and the target takes a –15-foot penalty.

bombs.name: Tanglefoot Bag (Lesser)
bombs.text: A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances. When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute. Many types of tanglefoot bag also grant an item bonus on attack rolls. On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and immobilized for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water. The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don’t have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well. The target takes a –10-foot penalty, and the Escape DC is 17.

bombs.name: Tanglefoot Bag (Moderate)
bombs.text: A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances. When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute. Many types of tanglefoot bag also grant an item bonus on attack rolls. On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and immobilized for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water. The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don’t have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls, the target takes a –15-foot penalty, and the Escape DC is 19.

bombs.name: Tanglefoot Bag (Greater)
bombs.text: A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances. When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute. Many types of tanglefoot bag also grant an item bonus on attack rolls. On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and immobilized for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water. The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don’t have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls, the target takes a –15-foot penalty, and the Escape DC is 28.

bombs.name: Tanglefoot Bag (Major)
bombs.text: A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances. When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute. Many types of tanglefoot bag also grant an item bonus on attack rolls. On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and immobilized for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water. The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don’t have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls, the target takes a –20-foot penalty, and the Escape DC is 37.

bombs.name: Thunderstone (Lesser)
bombs.text: When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be deafened until the end of its next turn. Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 1d4 sonic damage and 1 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 17.

bombs.name: Thunderstone (Moderate)
bombs.text: When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be deafened until the end of its next turn. Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 2d4 sonic damage and 2 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 20.

bombs.name: Thunderstone (Greater)
bombs.text: When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be deafened until the end of its next turn. Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 3d4 sonic damage and 3 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 28.

bombs.name: Thunderstone (Major)
bombs.text: When this stone hits a creature or a hard surface, it explodes with a deafening bang. A thunderstone deals the listed sonic damage and sonic splash damage, and each creature within 10 feet of the space in which the stone exploded must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be deafened until the end of its next turn. Many types of thunderstone grant an item bonus to attack rolls. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls. The bomb deals 4d4 sonic damage and 4 sonic splash damage, and the DC is 36.

elixirs.name: Antidote (Lesser)
elixirs.text: An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain an item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours. You gain a +2 item bonus.

elixirs.name: Antidote (Moderate)
elixirs.text: An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain an item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours. You gain a +3 item bonus.

elixirs.name: Antidote (Greater)
elixirs.text: An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain an item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours. You gain a +4 item bonus.

elixirs.name: Antidote (Major)
elixirs.text: An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain an item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours. You gain a +4 item bonus, and when you drink the antidote, you can immediately attempt a saving throw against one poison of 14th level or lower affecting you. If you succeed, the poison is neutralized.

elixirs.name: Antiplague (Lesser)
elixirs.text: Antiplague can fortify the body’s defenses against diseases. Upon drinking an antiplague, you gain an item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against diseases for 24 hours; this applies to your daily save against a disease’s progression. You gain a +2 item bonus.

elixirs.name: Antiplague (Moderate)
elixirs.text: Antiplague can fortify the body’s defenses against diseases. Upon drinking an antiplague, you gain an item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against diseases for 24 hours; this applies to your daily save against a disease’s progression. You gain a +3 item bonus.

elixirs.name: Antiplague (Greater)
elixirs.text: Antiplague can fortify the body’s defenses against diseases. Upon drinking an antiplague, you gain an item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against diseases for 24 hours; this applies to your daily save against a disease’s progression. You gain a +4 item bonus.

elixirs.name: Antiplague (Major)
elixirs.text: Antiplague can fortify the body’s defenses against diseases. Upon drinking an antiplague, you gain an item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against diseases for 24 hours; this applies to your daily save against a disease’s progression. You gain a +4 item bonus, and when you drink the antiplague, you can immediately attempt a saving throw against one disease of 14th level or lower affecting you. If you succeed, you are cured of the disease.

elixirs.name: Cheetah's Elixir (Lesser)
elixirs.text: Enzymatic compounds in this elixir strengthen and excite the muscles in your legs. You gain a status bonus to your Speed for the listed duration. The bonus is +5 feet, and the duration is 1 minute.

elixirs.name: Cheetah's Elixir (Moderate)
elixirs.text: Enzymatic compounds in this elixir strengthen and excite the muscles in your legs. You gain a status bonus to your Speed for the listed duration. The bonus is +10 feet, and the duration is 10 minutes.

elixirs.name: Cheetah's Elixir (Greater)
elixirs.text: Enzymatic compounds in this elixir strengthen and excite the muscles in your legs. You gain a status bonus to your Speed for the listed duration. The bonus is +10 feet, and the duration is 1 hour.

elixirs.name: Elixir of Life (Minor)
elixirs.text: Elixirs of life accelerate the body’s natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain the listed number of Hit Points and gain an item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes. The elixir restores 1d6 Hit Points, and the bonus is +1.

elixirs.name: Elixir of Life (Lesser)
elixirs.text: Elixirs of life accelerate the body’s natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain the listed number of Hit Points and gain an item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes. The elixir restores 3d6+6 Hit Points and the bonus is +1.

elixirs.name: Elixir of Life (Moderate)
elixirs.text: Elixirs of life accelerate the body’s natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain the listed number of Hit Points and gain an item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes. The elixir restores 5d6+12 Hit Points, and the bonus is +2.

elixirs.name: Elixir of Life (Greater)
elixirs.text: Elixirs of life accelerate the body’s natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain the listed number of Hit Points and gain an item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes. The elixir restores 7d6+18 Hit Points, and the bonus is +2.

elixirs.name: Elixir of Life (Major)
elixirs.text: Elixirs of life accelerate the body’s natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain the listed number of Hit Points and gain an item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes. The elixir restores 8d6+21 Hit Points, and the bonus is +3.

elixirs.name: Elixir of Life (True)
elixirs.text: Elixirs of life accelerate the body’s natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain the listed number of Hit Points and gain an item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes. The elixir restores 10d6+27 Hit Points, and the bonus is +4.

elixirs.name: Leaper's Elixir (Lesser)
elixirs.text: This tingly solution increases the elasticity and contraction of your leg muscles. For 1 minute after drinking this elixir, you can or as a single action instead of 2 actions. If you do, you don’t perform the initial (nor do you fail if you don’t Stride 10 feet).

elixirs.name: Leaper's Elixir (Greater)
elixirs.text: This tingly solution increases the elasticity and contraction of your leg muscles. For 1 minute after drinking this elixir, you can or as a single action instead of 2 actions. If you do, you don’t perform the initial (nor do you fail if you don’t Stride 10 feet). The maximum vertical distance you can jump with a High Jump is the same as you can jump horizontally with a Long Jump.

elixirs.name: Bestial Mutagen (Lesser)
elixirs.text: Your features transform into something bestial and you take on muscle mass, but your lumbering form is clumsy. You gain a +1 item bonus, your claw deals 1d4 slashing damage, your jaws deal 1d6 piercing damage, and the duration is 1 minute.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Athletics checks and unarmed attack rolls. You gain a claw unarmed attack with the agile trait and a jaws unarmed attack.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –1 penalty to AC and a –2 penalty to Reflex saves.

elixirs.name: Bestial Mutagen (Moderate)
elixirs.text: Your features transform into something bestial and you take on muscle mass, but your lumbering form is clumsy. You gain a +2 item bonus, your claw deals 1d6 slashing damage, your jaws deal 1d8 piercing damage, and the duration is 10 minutes.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Athletics checks and unarmed attack rolls. You gain a claw unarmed attack with the agile trait and a jaws unarmed attack.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –1 penalty to AC and a –2 penalty to Reflex saves.

elixirs.name: Bestial Mutagen (Greater)
elixirs.text: Your features transform into something bestial and you take on muscle mass, but your lumbering form is clumsy. You gain a +3 item bonus, your claw deals 1d8 slashing damage, your jaws deal 1d10 piercing damage, and the duration is 1 hour.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Athletics checks and unarmed attack rolls. You gain a claw unarmed attack with the agile trait and a jaws unarmed attack.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –1 penalty to AC and a –2 penalty to Reflex saves.

elixirs.name: Bestial Mutagen (Major)
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Athletics checks and unarmed attack rolls. You gain a claw unarmed attack with the agile trait and a jaws unarmed attack.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –1 penalty to AC and a –2 penalty to Reflex saves.
elixirs.text: Your features transform into something bestial and you take on muscle mass, but your lumbering form is clumsy. You gain a +4 item bonus, your claw deals 1d8 slashing damage, your jaws deal 1d10 piercing damage, and the duration is 1 hour. You gain weapon specialization with the claws and jaws, or greater weapon specialization, if you already have weapon specialization with these unarmed attacks.

elixirs.name: Cognitive Mutagen (Lesser)
elixirs.text: Your mind becomes clear and cognition flows freely, but physical matters seem ephemeral. The bonus is +1, and the duration is 1 minute.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to Recall Knowledge. Your critical failures on Recall Knowledge checks become failures instead.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and Acrobatics checks. You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.

elixirs.name: Cognitive Mutagen (Moderate)
elixirs.text: Your mind becomes clear and cognition flows freely, but physical matters seem ephemeral. The bonus is +2, and the duration is 10 minutes.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to Recall Knowledge. Your critical failures on Recall Knowledge checks become failures instead.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and Acrobatics checks. You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.

elixirs.name: Cognitive Mutagen (Greater)
elixirs.text: Your mind becomes clear and cognition flows freely, but physical matters seem ephemeral. The bonus is +3, and the duration is 1 hour. You become trained in one Intelligence-based skill, chosen at creation.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to Recall Knowledge. Your critical failures on Recall Knowledge checks become failures instead.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and Acrobatics checks. You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.

elixirs.name: Cognitive Mutagen (Major)
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks and all checks to Recall Knowledge. Your critical failures on Recall Knowledge checks become failures instead.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –2 penalty to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Athletics checks, and Acrobatics checks. You can carry 2 less Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered, and the maximum Bulk you can carry is reduced by 4.
elixirs.text: Your mind becomes clear and cognition flows freely, but physical matters seem ephemeral. The bonus is +4, and the duration is 1 hour. You become trained in one skill, chosen at creation.

elixirs.name: Eagle Eye Elixir (Lesser)
elixirs.text: After you drink this elixir, you notice subtle visual details. For the next hour, you gain an item bonus to Perception checks that is greater when attempting to find secret doors and traps. The bonus is +1, or +2 to find secret doors and traps.

elixirs.name: Eagle Eye Elixir (Moderate)
elixirs.text: After you drink this elixir, you notice subtle visual details. For the next hour, you gain an item bonus to Perception checks that is greater when attempting to find secret doors and traps. The bonus is +2, or +3 to find secret doors and traps.

elixirs.name: Eagle Eye Elixir (Greater)
elixirs.text: After you drink this elixir, you notice subtle visual details. For the next hour, you gain an item bonus to Perception checks that is greater when attempting to find secret doors and traps. The bonus is +3, or +4 to find secret doors and traps.

elixirs.name: Eagle Eye Elixir (Major)
elixirs.text: After you drink this elixir, you notice subtle visual details. For the next hour, you gain an item bonus to Perception checks that is greater when attempting to find secret doors and traps. The bonus is +3, or +4 to find secret doors and traps. Each time you pass within 10 feet of a secret door or trap, the GM automatically rolls a secret check for you to find it.

elixirs.name: Energy Mutagen (Lesser)
elixirs.text: When created, this mutagen is attuned to your choice of one of four energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. When consumed, the mutagen suffuses your body with energy that spills out of you whenever you attack. At higher levels, it can even grant you the ability to unleash the energy in controlled bursts. You gain resistance 5, add 1 point of damage on a hit with a melee weapon, and the duration is 1 minute.
elixirs.benefit: You gain resistance to the attuned energy type. Whenever you score a hit with a melee weapon, add the listed amount of damage of the attuned energy type.
elixirs.drawback: You gain weakness 5 to the other three energy types.

elixirs.name: Energy Mutagen (Moderate)
elixirs.text: When created, this mutagen is attuned to your choice of one of four energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. When consumed, the mutagen suffuses your body with energy that spills out of you whenever you attack. At higher levels, it can even grant you the ability to unleash the energy in controlled bursts. You gain resistance 10, add 1d4 damage on a hit with a melee weapon, and the duration is 10 minutes.
elixirs.benefit: You gain resistance to the attuned energy type. Whenever you score a hit with a melee weapon, add the listed amount of damage of the attuned energy type.
elixirs.drawback: You gain weakness 5 to the other three energy types.

elixirs.name: Energy Mutagen (Greater)
elixirs.text: When created, this mutagen is attuned to your choice of one of four energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. When consumed, the mutagen suffuses your body with energy that spills out of you whenever you attack. At higher levels, it can even grant you the ability to unleash the energy in controlled bursts. You gain resistance 15, add 1d6 damage on a hit with a melee weapon, and the duration is 1 hour. In addition, you can end the benefits of this mutagen to unleash a 30-foot cone of energy that deals 2d6 damage of the attuned type for every full 10 minutes of duration remaining (DC 25 basic Reflex save).
elixirs.benefit: You gain resistance to the attuned energy type. Whenever you score a hit with a melee weapon, add the listed amount of damage of the attuned energy type.
elixirs.drawback: You gain weakness 5 to the other three energy types.

elixirs.name: Energy Mutagen (Major)
elixirs.benefit: You gain resistance to the attuned energy type. Whenever you score a hit with a melee weapon, add the listed amount of damage of the attuned energy type.
elixirs.drawback: You gain weakness 5 to the other three energy types.
elixirs.text: When created, this mutagen is attuned to your choice of one of four energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. When consumed, the mutagen suffuses your body with energy that spills out of you whenever you attack. At higher levels, it can even grant you the ability to unleash the energy in controlled bursts. You gain resistance 20, add 2d6 damage on a hit with a melee weapon, and the duration is 1 hour. In addition, you can end the benefits of this mutagen to unleash a 30-foot cone of energy that deals 3d6 damage of the attuned type for every full 10 minutes of duration remaining (DC 32 basic Reflex save).

elixirs.name: Juggernaut Mutagen (Lesser)
elixirs.text: After you drink this mutagen, your body becomes thick and sturdy. You exhibit a healthy glow, though you tend to be ponderous and unobservant. The bonus is +1, you gain 5 temporary Hit Points, and the duration is 1 minute.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Fortitude saves and the listed number of temporary Hit Points. Whenever you are at maximum Hit Points for at least 1 full minute, you regain the temporary Hit Points.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –2 penalty to Will saves, Perception checks, and initiative rolls.

elixirs.name: Juggernaut Mutagen (Moderate)
elixirs.text: After you drink this mutagen, your body becomes thick and sturdy. You exhibit a healthy glow, though you tend to be ponderous and unobservant. The bonus is +2, you gain 10 temporary Hit Points, and the duration is 10 minutes.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Fortitude saves and the listed number of temporary Hit Points. Whenever you are at maximum Hit Points for at least 1 full minute, you regain the temporary Hit Points.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –2 penalty to Will saves, Perception checks, and initiative rolls.

elixirs.name: Juggernaut Mutagen (Greater)
elixirs.text: After you drink this mutagen, your body becomes thick and sturdy. You exhibit a healthy glow, though you tend to be ponderous and unobservant. The bonus is +3, you gain 30 temporary Hit Points, and the duration is 1 hour. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Fortitude saves and the listed number of temporary Hit Points. Whenever you are at maximum Hit Points for at least 1 full minute, you regain the temporary Hit Points.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –2 penalty to Will saves, Perception checks, and initiative rolls.

elixirs.name: Juggernaut Mutagen (Major)
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Fortitude saves and the listed number of temporary Hit Points. Whenever you are at maximum Hit Points for at least 1 full minute, you regain the temporary Hit Points.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –2 penalty to Will saves, Perception checks, and initiative rolls.
elixirs.text: After you drink this mutagen, your body becomes thick and sturdy. You exhibit a healthy glow, though you tend to be ponderous and unobservant. The bonus is +4, you gain 45 temporary Hit Points, and the duration is 1 hour. When you roll a success on a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead, and your critical failures on Fortitude saves become failures instead.

elixirs.name: Quicksilver Mutagen (Lesser)
elixirs.text: Your features become thin and angular. You become swifter and nimbler, but your body also becomes fragile. The bonus to rolls is +1, the bonus to Speed is +5 feet, and the duration is 1 minute.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Acrobatics checks, Stealth checks, Thievery checks, Reflex saves, and ranged attack rolls, and you gain the listed status bonus to your Speed.
elixirs.drawback: You take damage equal to twice your level; you can’t recover Hit Points lost in this way by any means while the mutagen lasts. You take a –2 penalty to Fortitude saves.

elixirs.name: Quicksilver Mutagen (Moderate)
elixirs.text: Your features become thin and angular. You become swifter and nimbler, but your body also becomes fragile. The bonus to rolls is +2, the bonus to Speed is +10 feet, and the duration is 10 minutes.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Acrobatics checks, Stealth checks, Thievery checks, Reflex saves, and ranged attack rolls, and you gain the listed status bonus to your Speed.
elixirs.drawback: You take damage equal to twice your level; you can’t recover Hit Points lost in this way by any means while the mutagen lasts. You take a –2 penalty to Fortitude saves.

elixirs.name: Quicksilver Mutagen (Greater)
elixirs.text: Your features become thin and angular. You become swifter and nimbler, but your body also becomes fragile. The bonus to rolls is +3, the bonus to Speed is +15 feet, and the duration is 1 hour.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Acrobatics checks, Stealth checks, Thievery checks, Reflex saves, and ranged attack rolls, and you gain the listed status bonus to your Speed.
elixirs.drawback: You take damage equal to twice your level; you can’t recover Hit Points lost in this way by any means while the mutagen lasts. You take a –2 penalty to Fortitude saves.

elixirs.name: Quicksilver Mutagen (Major)
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Acrobatics checks, Stealth checks, Thievery checks, Reflex saves, and ranged attack rolls, and you gain the listed status bonus to your Speed.
elixirs.drawback: You take damage equal to twice your level; you can’t recover Hit Points lost in this way by any means while the mutagen lasts. You take a –2 penalty to Fortitude saves.
elixirs.text: Your features become thin and angular. You become swifter and nimbler, but your body also becomes fragile. The bonus to rolls is +4, the bonus to Speed is +20 feet, and the duration is 1 hour.

elixirs.name: Serene Mutagen (Lesser)
elixirs.text: You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting. The bonus is +1, or +2 vs. mental, and the duration is 1 minute.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks. This bonus improves when you attempt Will saves against mental effects.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.

elixirs.name: Serene Mutagen (Moderate)
elixirs.text: You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting. The bonus is +2, or +3 vs. mental, and the duration is 10 minutes.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks. This bonus improves when you attempt Will saves against mental effects.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.

elixirs.name: Serene Mutagen (Greater)
elixirs.text: You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting. The bonus is +3, or +4 vs. mental, and the duration is 1 hour. When you roll a success on a Will save against a mental effect, you get a critical success instead.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks. This bonus improves when you attempt Will saves against mental effects.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.

elixirs.name: Serene Mutagen (Major)
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Will saves and Perception, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Survival checks. This bonus improves when you attempt Will saves against mental effects.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –1 penalty to attack rolls and save DCs of offensive spells, and a –1 penalty per damage die to all weapon, unarmed attack, and spell damage.
elixirs.text: You gain inner serenity, focused on fine details and steeled against mental assaults, but you find violence off-putting. The bonus is +4, and the duration is 1 hour. When you roll a success on a Will save against a mental effect, you get a critical success instead, and your critical failures on Will saves against mental effects become failures instead.

elixirs.name: Silvertongue Mutagen (Lesser)
elixirs.text: Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason. The bonus is +1, and the duration is 1 minute.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

elixirs.name: Silvertongue Mutagen (Moderate)
elixirs.text: Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason. The bonus is +2, and the duration is 10 minutes.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

elixirs.name: Silvertongue Mutagen (Greater)
elixirs.text: Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason. The bonus is +3, and the duration is 1 hour.
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.

elixirs.name: Silvertongue Mutagen (Major)
elixirs.benefit: You gain an item bonus to Deception, Diplomacy, Intimidation, and Performance checks. Your critical failures with any of these skill become failures instead.
elixirs.drawback: You take a –2 item penalty to Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Occultism, and Society checks. Choose one skill in which you are trained; for the duration, you become untrained in that skill. All your failures on checks to Recall Knowledge become critical failures.
elixirs.text: Your features become striking and your voice becomes musical and commanding, though facts and figures become hazy for you and emotion clouds your ability to reason. The bonus is +4, and the duration is 1 hour.

elixirs.name: Darkvision Elixir (Lesser)
elixirs.text: After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for the listed duration. The duration is 10 minutes.

elixirs.name: Darkvision Elixir (Moderate)
elixirs.text: After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for the listed duration. The duration is 1 hour.

elixirs.name: Darkvision Elixir (Greater)
elixirs.text: After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for the listed duration. The duration is 24 hours.

elixirs.name: Infiltrator's Elixir
elixirs.text: Favored by spies and tricksters, an infiltrator’s elixir is used to alter your appearance. When imbibed, you take the shape of a humanoid creature of your size, but different enough so you might be unrecognizable. If you aren’t a humanoid, you might take on a form more similar to your own, at the GM’s discretion. The creator of the elixir decides the basics of the appearance you transform into when you imbibe the elixir, including eye color, skin tone, and hair color. The elixir can’t change your form into that of a specific person. After the form takes hold, you retain it for the next 10 minutes. Drinking this elixir counts as setting up a disguise to Impersonate. You gain a +4 status bonus to your Deception DC to avoid others seeing through your disguise, and you add your level to this DC even if untrained.

elixirs.name: Bravo's Brew (Lesser)
elixirs.text: This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain an item bonus to Will saves, which is greater when attempting Will saves against fear. The bonus on Will saves is +1, or +2 against fear.

elixirs.name: Bravo's Brew (Moderate)
elixirs.text: This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain an item bonus to Will saves, which is greater when attempting Will saves against fear. The bonus on Will saves is +2, or +3 against fear.

elixirs.name: Bravo's Brew (Greater)
elixirs.text: This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain an item bonus to Will saves, which is greater when attempting Will saves against fear. The bonus on Will saves is +3, or +4 against fear. If you roll a success on a save against fear, you get a critical success instead.

elixirs.name: Cat's Eye Elixir
elixirs.text: After you consume this elixir, your vision sharpens and you become sensitive to even the most minute movements. For the next minute, you reduce the flat check to target hidden creatures to 5, and you don’t need to attempt a flat check to target concealed creatures. These benefits apply only against creatures within 30 feet of you.

elixirs.name: Comprehension Elixir (Lesser)
elixirs.text: This bitter draught opens your mind to the potential of the written word. For the listed duration after drinking this elixir, you can understand any words you read, so long as they are written in a common language. This elixir doesn’t automatically allow you to understand codes or extremely esoteric passages—you still need to attempt a skill check to Decipher Writing. The duration is 1 minute.

elixirs.name: Comprehension Elixir (Greater)
elixirs.text: This bitter draught opens your mind to the potential of the written word. For the listed duration after drinking this elixir, you can understand any words you read, so long as they are written in a common language. This elixir doesn’t automatically allow you to understand codes or extremely esoteric passages—you still need to attempt a skill check to Decipher Writing. The duration is 10 minutes.

elixirs.name: Stone Fist Elixir
elixirs.text: Your fists become hard as stone. For 1 hour, your fists deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage and lose the nonlethal trait.

elixirs.name: Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser)
elixirs.text: This tincture lets you pinpoint your foes. For the next 5 minutes, your alchemical bomb Strikes reduce the circumstance bonus to AC your targets gain from cover. Reduce your targets’ circumstance bonus by 1.

elixirs.name: Bomber's Eye Elixir (Greater)
elixirs.text: This tincture lets you pinpoint your foes. For the next 5 minutes, your alchemical bomb Strikes reduce the circumstance bonus to AC your targets gain from cover. Reduce your targets’ circumstance bonus by 2.

elixirs.name: Salamander Elixir (Lesser)
elixirs.text: This elixir is made from salamander scales to withstand fire. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe heat.

elixirs.name: Salamander Elixir (Moderate)
elixirs.text: This elixir is made from salamander scales to withstand fire. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe heat. You’re also protected from extreme heat.

elixirs.name: Salamander Elixir (Greater)
elixirs.text: This elixir is made from salamander scales to withstand fire. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe heat. You’re also protected from extreme and incredible heat.

elixirs.name: Winter Wolf Elixir (Lesser)
elixirs.text: This elixir warms your core and improves your circulation. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe cold.

elixirs.name: Winter Wolf Elixir (Moderate)
elixirs.text: This elixir warms your core and improves your circulation. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe cold. You’re also protected from extreme cold.

elixirs.name: Winter Wolf Elixir (Greater)
elixirs.text: This elixir warms your core and improves your circulation. For 24 hours, you are protected from the effects of severe cold. You’re also protected from extreme and incredible cold.

elixirs.name: Mistform Elixir (Lesser)
elixirs.text: A faint mist emanates from your skin, making you concealed for the listed duration. As usual being concealed when your position is still obvious, you can’t use this concealment to or . The duration is 3 rounds.

elixirs.name: Mistform Elixir (Moderate)
elixirs.text: A faint mist emanates from your skin, making you concealed for the listed duration. As usual being concealed when your position is still obvious, you can’t use this concealment to or . The duration is 1 minute.

elixirs.name: Mistform Elixir (Greater)
elixirs.text: A faint mist emanates from your skin, making you concealed for the listed duration. As usual being concealed when your position is still obvious, you can’t use this concealment to or . The duration is 5 minutes.

elixirs.name: Sea Touch Elixir (Lesser)
elixirs.text: This briny concoction alters the skin on your hands and feet. The spaces between your fingers and toes become webbed, granting you a swim Speed of 20 feet for the listed duration. The duration is 10 minutes.

elixirs.name: Sea Touch Elixir (Moderate)
elixirs.text: This briny concoction alters the skin on your hands and feet. The spaces between your fingers and toes become webbed, granting you a swim Speed of 20 feet for the listed duration. The duration is 1 hour, and you can breathe underwater.

elixirs.name: Sea Touch Elixir (Greater)
elixirs.text: This briny concoction alters the skin on your hands and feet. The spaces between your fingers and toes become webbed, granting you a swim Speed of 20 feet for the listed duration. The duration is 24 hours, and you can breathe underwater.

elixirs.name: Stone Body Mutagen (Lesser)
elixirs.text: This mutagen calcifies your body making it as hard as stone. You gain resistance 5 to physical damage (except bludgeoning) and the duration is 10 minutes.
elixirs.benefit: You gain resistance to physical damage (except bludgeoning) equal to the listed amount.
elixirs.drawback: Your Speeds are reduced by 10 feet (minimum 5 feet) and you take a –2 penalty to Reflex saves.

elixirs.name: Stone Body Mutagen (Moderate)
elixirs.text: This mutagen calcifies your body making it as hard as stone. You gain resistance 5 to physical damage (except bludgeoning) and the duration is 1 hour.
elixirs.benefit: You gain resistance to physical damage (except bludgeoning) equal to the listed amount.
elixirs.drawback: Your Speeds are reduced by 10 feet (minimum 5 feet) and you take a –2 penalty to Reflex saves.

elixirs.name: Stone Body Mutagen (Greater)
elixirs.benefit: You gain resistance to physical damage (except bludgeoning) equal to the listed amount.
elixirs.drawback: Your Speeds are reduced by 10 feet (minimum 5 feet) and you take a –2 penalty to Reflex saves.
elixirs.text: This mutagen calcifies your body making it as hard as stone. You gain resistance 10 to physical damage (except bludgeoning) and the duration is 1 hour.

elixirs.name: Elixir of Rejuvenation
elixirs.text: The elixir of rejuvenation restores a creature to full health and eradicates toxins affecting it. When you drink this elixir, you’re restored to your maximum Hit Points, and all afflictions of 20th level or lower affecting you are removed. You can instead administer this elixir to a creature that has been dead for a week or less. When you do, that creature is instantly brought back to life with 1 Hit Point and no spell slots, Focus Points, or other daily resources. ,

elixirs.name: Sun Orchid Elixir
elixirs.text: When you drink this elixir, you physically become as you were in whatever phase of your youth you desire. Your new body begins in peak health, regardless of what your actual condition was at that age. Any physical or mental imperfections— including scars, lost limbs, and curses, diseases, poisons of 20th level or lower— are removed, and you regain your full Hit Points. You immediately begin to age normally again, with your natural lifespan extended as if you had never aged past your new apparent age. You retain all your memories. Unlike Crafting most items, brewing the sun orchid elixir takes 1 month’s time. While an individual vial of sun orchid elixir isn’t unique, the formula is unique, and it’s known only to Artokus Kirran of Thuvia.

elixirs.name: Lastwall Soup
elixirs.text: Crimson Reclaimers make this rich, hearty soup using herbs that baffle the senses of the undead. A bowl of Lastwall soup is as nourishing as a full meal. In addition, for 1 hour after consuming a bowl of Lastwall soup, you gain a +2 item bonus to checks and DCs against undead.

poisons.name: Arsenic
poisons.text: This toxin is a compound of arsenic and other substances. You can’t reduce your sickened condition while affected.

poisons.name: Giant Centipede Venom
poisons.text: Giant centipede venom causes severe muscle stiffness.
poisons.stage1: 1d6 poison damage (1 round); Stage 2 1d8 poison damage and flat-footed (1 round);
poisons.stage3: 1d12 poison damage, clumsy 1, and flat-footed (1 round)

poisons.name: Belladonna
poisons.text: Sometimes called “deadly nightshade,” belladonna is a widely available toxin produced from a plant similar to a tomato.
poisons.stage3: 1d6 poison damage, confused, and sickened 1 (1 minute)

poisons.name: Black Smear Poison
poisons.text: Many calignis use a debilitating poison crafted from subterranean fungi.  (1 round);   (1 round)

poisons.name: Black Adder Venom
poisons.text: Adder venom is a simple but effective way to enhance a weapon.
poisons.stage1: 1d8 poison damage (1 round); Stage 2 1d10 poison damage (1 round);

poisons.name: Lethargy Poison
poisons.text: Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by drow and others who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls unconscious. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.
poisons.stage3: unconscious with no Perception check to wake up (1 round) Stage 4 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up (1d4 hours).

poisons.name: Blue Dragonfly Poison
poisons.text: Boggards brew a potent toxin made from blue dragonflies. Swampseers consume this mixture to awaken their divine powers, but the poison inspires crippling hallucinations in most other creatures.  (10 minutes);   and   (10 minutes);   and   (1 minute)

poisons.name: Cytillesh Oil
poisons.text: This thick substance is distilled from the mind-robbing cytillesh fungus, though it lacks memory-altering capabilities.

poisons.name: Graveroot
poisons.text: The opaque white sap from the graveroot shrub clouds the mind.

poisons.name: False Death
poisons.text: Typically used to fake one’s death, this poison swiftly causes the imbiber to lose consciousness and suppresses vital signs. A creature examining the unconscious target must succeed at a   check against the imbiber’s   DC + 4 to determine that the target is alive, and a critical success allows the examiner to determine that a toxin is causing the effect. The false death toxin has an extremely bitter taste (Perception DC 10 to detect), making it difficult to trick a creature into consuming the poison against its wishes.   (1 round);   (1 hour);
poisons.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 78

poisons.name: Hunting Spider Venom
poisons.text: This venom erodes its target’s defenses, aiding the spider in securing prey.
poisons.stage2: 1d12 poison damage, clumsy 1, and flat-footed (1 round);
poisons.stage3: 2d6 poison damage, clumsy 2, and flat-footed (1 round)

poisons.name: Giant Scorpion Venom
poisons.text: Scorpion venom is excruciating and its effects are somewhat debilitating.

poisons.name: Giant Wasp Venom
poisons.text: Giant wasp venom interferes with a victim’s movement.

poisons.name: Isolation Draught
poisons.text: Derived from steeping toxic highland plum pits in refined grain alcohols, this clear tonic slowly shuts down the imbiber’s senses. , –3 to all Perception checks (1 minute);  , –5 to all Perception checks (1 minute);  , deafened, –5 to all Perception checks (5 minutes)
poisons.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 79

poisons.name: Malyass Root Paste
poisons.text: Malyass root paste sees use to impede opponents in athletic competitions, in addition to espionage and tracking.
poisons.stage1: clumsy 1 and –10-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 minute);
poisons.stage2: clumsy 2 and –20-foot status penalty to all Speeds (1 minute);
poisons.stage3: clumsy 3, flat-footed, and –30-foot status penalty to all Speeds

poisons.name: Addlebrain
poisons.text: Certain Scarlet Triad poisoners use toxins like addlebrain to keep captured prisoners docile and compliant for short periods of time until they can be properly shackled and imprisoned. Addlebrain is distilled from a hallucinogenic lichen that can often be found growing in the sewers below particularly large cities like Katapesh.  Once soaked in special reagents and then dried, a dose of addlebrain must be either lit with flame or tossed into a fire to activate, whereupon it unleashes a cloud of toxin as normal for an inhaled poison.  1 and   1 (10 minutes);  , enfeebled 4, and stupefied 4 (1 day)

poisons.name: Nettleweed Residue
poisons.text: Concentrated sap of stinging weeds makes an effective toxin.

poisons.name: Wyvern Poison
poisons.text: Properly harvested and preserved, the poison from a wyvern’s sting is effective and direct.

poisons.name: Lich Dust
poisons.text: Dust salvaged from the remains of a destroyed lich has paralytic properties that make it a valuable poison.
poisons.stage1: fatigued (1 minute); Stage 2 5d6 poison damage and fatigued (1 minute);
poisons.stage3: 5d6 poison damage, fatigued, and paralyzed (1 minute)

poisons.name: Spider Root
poisons.text: A paste made by mashing the fine, threadlike roots of a certain creeper vine, spider root renders a victim clumsy and maladroit.

poisons.name: Wolfsbane
poisons.text: Wolfsbane appears in folklore for its link to werecreatures. If you are afflicted with lycanthropy and survive

poisons.name: Shadow Essence
poisons.text: Distilled from the Plane of Shadow, this oily substance imposes tenebrous effects. The enfeebled condition from shadow essence lasts for 24 hours.
poisons.stage1: 3d6 negative damage and 2d6 poison damage (1 round);
poisons.stage2: 3d6 negative damage, 2d6 poison damage, and enfeebled 1 (1 round);
poisons.stage3: 3d6 negative damage, 2d6 poison damage, and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

poisons.name: Blightburn Resin
poisons.text: This tacky, hardened sap is harvested from trees infected by fungal blights and exposed to open flames.

poisons.name: Mage Bane
poisons.text: Upon being mixed and injected into the bloodstream, this powder of the crimson orchid quickly assaults the brain and nerves, disrupting the victim’s ability to piece together coherent thoughts and spells.  (1 round);
poisons.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 79

poisons.name: Slumber Wine
poisons.text: Slumber wine sees its greatest use in games of intrigue, where an absence can be more devastating than injury. Characters unconscious from slumber wine can’t wake up by any means while the poison lasts, don’t need to eat or drink while unconscious in this way, and appear to be recently dead unless an examiner succeeds at a DC 40 Medicine check.

poisons.name: Deathcap Powder
poisons.text: The toxic deathcap mushroom can be dried, ground, and treated to form a flavorless powder with accelerated effects.

poisons.name: Gorgon's Breath
poisons.text: Gorgon’s breath is a fine powder that can easily enter living creatures’ bloodstreams through their lungs before binding to mucous membranes and causing any nearby soft tissues to harden.  (1 round);   (1 round);
poisons.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 78

poisons.name: Purple Worm Venom
poisons.text: Venom from enormous purple worms leaves a victim weakened.

poisons.name: Dragon Bile
poisons.text: A mix of digestive juices and green dragon poison glands nauseates the victim as its flesh is digested from within.

poisons.name: Mindfog Mist
poisons.text: Mindfog mist can be used to undermine spellcasters, as its effect on a victim’s mental faculties are swift and powerful.

poisons.name: Nightmare Vapor
poisons.text: Purportedly sourced from any number of outlandish locales, nightmare vapor is most often created by boiling the sweat collected from humanoids caught in the throes of terrible nightmares.

poisons.name: Weeping Midnight
poisons.text: Alchemists have refined the devastatingly allergenic pollen of the widow orchid to create this venom, which swiftly causes the victim’s eyes to leak mucus and swell shut.  (1 round);   (1 round);   (1 round)
poisons.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 79

poisons.name: Brimstone Fumes
poisons.text: Fumes from the forges of Hell drain health and strength alike.

poisons.name: Frenzy Oil
poisons.text: This oil, which is pressed from   spores and mixed with a combination of acacia ash and thistle seeds, seeps into the skin of living creatures, initially inspiring irritability that unpredictably manifests as berserk rage. , attack nearby creatures as if   (1 round);  , attack nearby creatures as if confused (1 round)
poisons.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 78
poisons.stage2: 6d6 mental damage, attack nearby creatures as if confused (1 round);

poisons.name: Hemlock
poisons.text: Concentrated hemlock is a particularly deadly toxin that halts muscle action—including that of the victim’s heart.

poisons.name: King's Sleep
poisons.text: King’s sleep is an insidious long-term poison that can seem like a disease or even death from natural causes on a venerable target. The drained condition from king’s sleep is cumulative with each failed save and can’t be removed while the poison lasts.

poisons.name: Black Lotus Extract
poisons.text: Black lotus extract causes severe internal bleeding.

poisons.name: Oblivion Essence
poisons.text: Created from a daemon’s powdered soul gems or refined from the waters of Abaddon’s rivers, oblivion essence causes victims to rapidly age and decay.  (1 round);  , and slowed 1 (1 round);
poisons.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 79

poisons.name: Tears of Death
poisons.text: Tears of death are among the most powerful of alchemical poisons, distilled from extracts of five other deadly poisons in just the right ratios.

poisons.name: Nightmare Salt
poisons.text: This potent poison consists of crystals whose flavor and appearance mimics edible salt but whose effects are deadly: victims experience periods of waking nightmares that overload the senses and eventually result in death through a combination of shock and exhaustion.  once every 1d4 hours, plus   (1 day);   for 1 minute once every 1d4 hours, plus frightened 3 and fatigued (1 day);
poisons.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 79
poisons.stage3: frightened 3, plus confused for 1d4 minutes, once every hour, plus fatigued (1 day);

tools.name: Alchemical Crossbow
tools.text: This crossbow can deliver alchemically infused bolts. The strange weapon has a metal bracket mounted on the side of the stock near the lath. As an action, you can load a single lesser alchemical bomb into the bracket; this bomb must be one that deals energy damage (such as an  ,  ,  ,  , or  ). The next three attacks made with the crossbow deal 1d6 damage of the bomb’s damage type in addition to the crossbow’s normal damage. If the second and third attacks are not all made within 1 minute of the first attack, the bomb’s energy is wasted. These attacks never deal splash damage or other special effects of the bomb and are not modified by any abilities that add to or modify a bomb’s effect. The addition of the bracket serves to unbalance the weapon, reducing its range to 30 feet. It otherwise functions as a crossbow (when determining damage, reload, and so on). Creatures use their crossbow proficiency when using the alchemical crossbow. The alchemical crossbow costs 25 gp.

tools.name: Tindertwig
tools.text: An alchemical substance applied to one end of this tiny wooden stick ignites when struck against a rough surface. Creating a flame with a tindertwig is much faster than creating a flame with flint and steel. You can ignite the tindertwig and touch it to a flammable object as part of the same Interact action.

tools.name: Snake Oil
tools.text: You can apply snake oil onto a wound or other outward symptom of an affliction or condition (such as sores from a disease or discoloration from a poison). For the next hour, the symptom disappears and the wounded or afflicted creature doesn’t feel as if it still has the wound or affliction, though all effects remain. A creature can uncover the ruse by succeeding at a DC 17 Perception check, but only if it uses a Seek action to specifically examine the snake oil’s effects.

tools.name: Smokestick (Lesser)
tools.price: The radius of the burst is 20 feet.
tools.text: With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

tools.name: Sunrod
tools.text: This 1-foot-long, gold-tipped rod glows after it’s struck on a hard surface. For the next 6 hours, it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet).

tools.name: Silversheen
tools.text: You can slather this silvery paste onto one melee weapon, one thrown weapon, or 10 pieces of ammunition. Silversheen spoils quickly, so once you open a vial, you must use it all at once, rather than saving it. For the next hour, the weapon or ammunition counts as silver instead of its normal precious material (such as cold iron) for any physical damage it deals.

tools.name: Smokestick (Greater)
tools.price: The radius of the burst is 20 feet.
tools.text: With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

tools.name: Philosopher's Stone
tools.text: An alchemist with the   feat can create a philosopher’s stone once per month by spending 1 batch of infused reagents during their daily preparations using the advanced alchemy class feature. This is the only way to create a philosopher’s stone.  At a glance, a philosopher’s stone appears to be an ordinary, sooty piece of natural rock. Breaking the rock open with a   action (DC 35) reveals a cavity at the stone’s heart. The cavity is lined with a rare type of quicksilver that can transmute base metals into precious metals or create an  .   To use the quicksilver, you must be legendary in Crafting and have the   feat. You can then use the stone’s quicksilver for one of two effects:
tools.activate: Interact or 1 or more days; see below
